metadata.title: CVE-2015-2060 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
cabextract before 1.6 does not properly check for leading slashes whenextracting files, which allows remote attackers to conduct absolutedirectory traversal attacks via a malformed UTF-8 character that is changedto a UTF-8 encoded slash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-2060` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cabextract - 1.6-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cabextract package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6-1').
